Entries.default: "Damn pirates! Ondra take your scabrous souls for fish food!"
"What a mess. We'll be needing help getting the Defiant off the ground."
"Something you need help with?"
"Sooner we're off this island, sooner I can put a fist in that pirate captain's face."
"Well? You seeing something I'm not?"
"Ah, bless you, lord. Would have been a sorry way to go, caught up in a dead pirate's trap."
Entries.female: "Ah, bless you, lady. Would have been a sorry way to go, caught up in a dead pirate's trap."

Entries.default: "Been trying to find a way past without losing a leg or getting a face-full of poison."

"It's just bats and stinking corpses in this cave. You find anyone else?"

He gingerly sets his weight on his injured foot, grimacing.
"We've got a campfire going on the beach."
"Not yet."
[Lie] "Not yet."
"Get moving. You've wasted enough of my time."
"Then I'll head that way myself. See you on the beach, captain."

"Well, I'll get a fire going on the beach. If anyone's left alive, chances are they'll spot the smoke. 

See you there, captain."
"All right, ease up, now. I'll get a fire going on the beach. See you then?"
"Do you know anything about this place?"
"I can take care of a few traps."
"I see them. I'll guide you through."
"You're afraid of a few snares? You coward. No wonder those pirates ran us aground."
[Leave] "I'll see what I can do."
[Set off the traps prematurely with a few heavy stones.]

"Clever, that. Though, it's a good thing none of them were of the exploding variety."
 
"Eld Engrim would have got a kick out of that, I bet."

"...Ha! Well! Here's me, then, alive and well. See here! What'd I say? You can't stop Beodul!"

He pauses, panting, to squint at you.

You point out a safe path along the floor, and Beodul makes his way along, sweating and stiff-jawed. 

Safe on the other side, he lets out the breath he's been holding, and wipes his brow.
"Well, they sting something fierce, so mind yourself."
"What do we do now?"
[Leave] "Farewell."
"We got turned around in that storm. Hard to be sure just where we are."
"Not much chance of us moving the ship on our own. But we're in charted waters. There's bound to be a town nearby."

You wreak havoc upon the traps to the tune of snapping metal teeth and clattering darts.

When the cacophony is ended, Beodul peers out from between his fingers, and gives you a broad grin.

"What! You... you puffed-up... You'd have been far worse off without me fighting for you!"

Beodul's face goes an impressive shade of ruddy purple. He puffs out his chest.
"Beodul! Still alive and calling everybody scabrous, I see!"

"Well, now. Thought you were good as a corpse, if I'm honest. 

"Good to see you on your feet, but watch your step. There's enough traps here to cut us both to ribbons."

"Ed√©r? And I see that corpse we've been carting around is looking a sight more sprightly.

"Good to see the two of you, but mind your step. I've got myself in a spot of trouble."
"Well, if Port Maje's anything like the other Vailian ports I've been to, my advice is to do your business before you get drunk. They'll talk the boots right off you."
"Can't do much about the Defiant until the tide comes in. In the meantime, if you're serious about chasing that giant, we'll need a heading."

"Well, ah... If you're certain." 

Beodul gets to his feet.

"To Hel with the lot of you! Here's spit in your eye, Abydon!"

He clambers to his feet and barrels forward, scowling defiantly all the while.

"You... That was a rotten old trick, that." 

Beodul folds his arms, red-faced and sullen.
"Glad to see you too, farmboy. Bless you both - it would have been a sorry way to go, caught up in a dead pirate's trap."
"Well now we got a boatswain. Just need a boat."
